intro: Nasa ranunculifolia subsp. pamparomasii, commonly known as the Pampas nasa, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in high-altitude grasslands. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic qualities. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and somewhat endangered species in its native habitat.
